definitions: To extract (ore or coal, for example) from the earth.
To dig into the earth to extract ore or coal.
To lay mines in (an area of land or water).
To extract (information or data) from a larger body of information.
examples: They mined for gold in California.
The company mined a rich vein of copper.
The harbor was mined during the war.
Analysts mined the data for insights.
